channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13114] [UNITTEST] TestEnableTableHandler.testDeleteForSureClearsAllTableRowsFromMeta
item.description:
I've seen this fail a few times. It just happened now on internal rig. Looking into it....


REGRESSION:  org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.handler.TestEnableTableHandler.testDeleteForSureClearsAllTableRowsFromMeta



Error Message:

expected:<0> but was:<1>



Stack Trace:

java.lang.AssertionError: expected:<0> but was:<1>

        at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)

        at org.junit.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:743)

        at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:118)

        at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:555)

        at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:542)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.handler.TestEnableTableHandler.testDeleteForSureClearsAllTableRowsFromMeta(TestEnableTableHandler.java:151)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: what version was it stack?
Here is a bit of extra info so can see why this failing. Committed to branch-1+
Andrey Stepachev Was 1.0 build IIRC. It failed on 1.1. on apache just recently (no link because builds is down at mo)

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-1.1 #275 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.1/275/)
HBASE-13114 [UNITTEST] TestEnableTableHandler.testDeleteForSureClearsAllTableRowsFromMeta (stack: rev 619d58f9b5aa6f2d24e5ab8166cddec16a4c1b4b)

  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/handler/DeleteTableHandler.java
  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/handler/TestEnableTableHandler.java

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #6237 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/6237/)
HBASE-13114 [UNITTEST] TestEnableTableHandler.testDeleteForSureClearsAllTableRowsFromMeta (stack: rev 09e9c92d7699b985f45a48242a24af7c848926f0)

  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/handler/DeleteTableHandler.java
  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/handler/TestEnableTableHandler.java

Dug into this today, the problem is very similar to HBASE-13182, which is basically that Admin is not really synchronous and it can return earlier when getTableDescriptorByTableName() is null. If we add a sleep of few 100 ms before scanning META after deleting the table the problem is less frequent, however that is only masquerading the real problem. The best option seems to use a latch for now in the same way Matteo Bertozzi did in HBASE-13179 and HBASE-13182.

why we catch any exception from create/delete and go on?
shouldn't we fail the test? the outcome after that will be wrong anyway.
other than that patch looks good to me. hopefully this stuff will be removed and fixed once and for all with HBASE-13204

This message is automatically generated.

looks good to me.

btw, would it be better to have this observer in HBaseTestingUtility and some minimal infrastructure to handle that in other tests if needed?
say we have methods createTable(), that would be good to have them use this observer.
what do you think?

Attached patch with suggestions from Matteo Bertozzi.

Andrey Stepachev yeah, I thought about moving the observer to HBaseTestingUtility but as Matteo Bertozzi said, after HBASE-13204 that shouldn't be required.

If you guys think we will have a greater gain by using the latch across all createTable()/enableTable()/disableTable()/deleteTable() calls then lets open a new JIRA, personally I think we are gaining too little by adding the latch to every time we need to create or delete a table.

Andrey Stepachev agreed with esteban, we don't need everywhere that complete sync behavior. The only places are the one that really requires that everything is completed. e.g. the ACL checks that are executed in the postOperationHandler, the MasterObserver test because it explicitly want to check that the postOperationHandler is called. and this guy here because it checks an operation that is executed after the delete is considered completed by the client.

since the impact of this is mainly in test, and HBASE-13204 may get in 1.1 we may avoid to move out this thing that will be removed anyway at some point.
Esteban Gutierrez, Matteo Bertozzi sounds good. Lets leave this patch as is. Good work, thanks.

stack Esteban Gutierrez can we remove the extra debug in deleteTableHandler, or at least move it under trace? or do you think is useful?
Done, moved to trace level.

Esteban Gutierrez sorry I was talking about the debug patch that stack committed, not your code. your code was great and I was committing it already.
I was just thinking if we should remove that extra debug in DeleteTableHandler that I'm not really useful how much it is useful.
Ha!. Moving from debug to trace is ok in stack's patch. Let me update my patch with that change and revert the change to trace from the addendum.
The log should never happen. Meta should be cleared when it runs. Ok if you want to make it TRACE but I'd say fine as DEBUG too.
I think we can leave it as is for now (i will remove the latest version of my patch to avoid any confusion)

fix commit doesn't have the jira in the message:

  • master: b728e66708cba45e1a030a8e06971a3c9d431dc7
  • branch-1: f6095adea64912deaebfaf2a6a5881b820d315b2
